abstract: The Federal Reserve’s decisions may have inflated the price of financial assets, but Ben Bernanke says they kept a bad financial situation from getting worse.
snippet: The Federal Reserve’s decisions may have inflated the price of financial assets, but Ben Bernanke says they kept a bad financial situation from getting worse.
lead_paragraph: By the end of our recent conversation, Ben S. Bernanke, the former chairman of the Federal Reserve, and I had a gentleman’s bet. I believe the easy money policies he pushed for and put in place while serving as Fed chairman starting in 2008 (and that remain in place under his successor, Janet L. Yellen) will lead inevitably to a near-term financial crisis; he thinks that idea is beyond ridiculous.

headline.main: A Debate With Bernanke Over the Fed’s Easy Money Policies
